content:
Sadly, the feeling that I've been having that I've lost my mojo seems to not be just a feeling :disappointed: https://github.com/klonos

  • 2014: 44 contributions (that's when I started with Backdrop)
  • 2015: 309 contributions (100% creating issues and commenting on them - so all talk and no code)
  • 2016: 770 contributions ( @Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) ++ introduces me to creating PR via the GitHub web UI )
  • 2017: 832
  • 2018: 1591
  • 2019: 1620
  • 2020: 595 :sweat: :sweat: :sweat:
klonos - Overview
Silly dad. @drupal enthusiast. Member of the @backdrop CMS Project Management Committee. Dev/support @salsadigitalauorg. - klonos
@klonos Year's not over yet! :smiley:
True that @BWPanda ...you think that I can double my contributions from 10+ months within a month and a half? :sweat_smile:

Seriously though, it's been a tough year and I believe for half of it you've been in Greece with your family, so don't feel bad for not giving the same attention to Backdrop this year that you have in the past :heart:
Yeah ...being with my family does seem to turn me into a regular human being. I'll become a robot when I return to Melbourne and are all by myself again :sweat_smile:

Yeah ...being with my family does seem to turn me into a regular human being. I'll become a robot when I return to Melbourne and are all by myself again

@klonos You being a robot doesn't sound like very sustainable plan for Backdrop or for you personally. ;-)
I hope we can find a better plan and still get all the things done!

I'll become a robot when I return to Melbourne and are all by myself again

That sounds horrible! :robot:

Better a happy husband and dad than an unhappy but busy robot. :happy:
The robot thing is by choice :smile: ...working on things I enjoy doing takes my mind off of being away from my family.
